verses.verse: Then Joseph<WH3130> went<WH935> in and told<WH5046> Pharaoh,<WH6547> and said,<WH559> "My father<WH1> and my brothers,<WH251> with their flocks,<WH6629> their herds,<WH1241> and all that they own,<WH935> have come out of the land<WH776> of Canaan;<WH3667> and behold,<WH776> they are in the land of Goshen.<WH1657>"
From<WH7097> among his brothers<WH251> he took<WH3947> five<WH2568> men,<WH582> and presented<WH3322> them to<WH6440> Pharaoh.<WH6547>

Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "What is your occupation?<WH4639>" They said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> "Your servants<WH5650> are shepherds,<WH7462> both we,<WH1> and our fathers."

They said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> "We have come<WH935> to live<WH1481> as foreigners in the land,<WH776> for there is no pasture<WH4829> for your servants<WH5650>' flocks.<WH6629> For the famine<WH7458> is severe<WH3515> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667> Now therefore,<WH5650> please let your servants dwell<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Goshen.<WH1657>"
Pharaoh<WH6547> spoke<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> saying,<WH559> "Your father<WH1> and your brothers<WH251> have come to you.<WH935>

The land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> is before you.<WH6440> Make<WH3427> your<WH6440> father<WH1> and your brothers<WH251> dwell<WH3427> in the best of the land.<WH776> Let them dwell<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Goshen.<WH1657> If you know<WH3045> any able men<WH582> among them,<WH7760> then put them<WH7760> in charge<WH8269> of my livestock.<WH4735>"
Joseph<WH3130> brought in<WH935> Jacob,<WH3290> his father,<WH1> and set him<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh,<WH6547> and Jacob<WH3290> blessed<WH1288> Pharaoh.<WH6547>
Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "How<WH4100> many are the days of the years of your life?<WH3117>"

Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> "The days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of my pilgrimage<WH4033> are one hundred<WH3967> thirty<WH7970> years.<WH8141> Few<WH4592> and evil<WH7451> have been the days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of my life,<WH2416> and they have not attained<WH5381> to the days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of my fathers<WH1> in the days<WH3117> of their pilgrimage.<WH4033>"
Jacob<WH3290> blessed<WH1288> Pharaoh,<WH6547> and went out<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of Pharaoh.<WH6547>

Joseph<WH3130> placed<WH3427> his father<WH1> and his brothers,<WH251> and gave<WH5414> them a possession<WH272> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> in the best<WH4315> of the land,<WH776> in the land<WH776> of Rameses,<WH7486> as Pharaoh<WH6547> had commanded.<WH6680>
Joseph<WH3130> nourished<WH3557> his father,<WH1> his brothers,<WH251> and all of his father<WH1>'s household,<WH1004> with bread,<WH3899> according<WH6310> to their families.<WH2945>

There was no bread<WH3899> in all the land;<WH776> for the famine<WH7458> was very<WH3966> severe,<WH3515> so that the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> and the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> fainted<WH3856> by reason<WH6440> of the famine.<WH7458>

Joseph<WH3130> gathered up<WH3950> all the money<WH3701> that was found<WH4672> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> for the grain<WH7668> which they bought:<WH7666> and Joseph<WH3130> brought<WH935> the money<WH3701> into Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house.<WH1004>

When the money<WH3701> was all spent<WH8552> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> all the Egyptians<WH4714> came<WH935> to Joseph,<WH3130> and said,<WH559> "Give<WH3051> us bread,<WH3899> for why should we die<WH4191> in your presence?<WH3701> For our money fails.<WH656>"
Joseph<WH3130> said,<WH559> "Give<WH3051> me your livestock;<WH4735> and I will give<WH5414> you food for your livestock,<WH4735> if your money<WH3701> is gone.<WH656>"

They brought<WH935> their livestock<WH4735> to Joseph,<WH3130> and Joseph<WH3130> gave<WH5414> them bread<WH3899> in exchange for the horses,<WH5483> and for the flocks,<WH6629> and for the<WH4735> herds,<WH1241> and for the donkeys:<WH2543> and he fed<WH5095> them with bread<WH3899> in exchange for all their livestock<WH4735> for that year.<WH8141>

When that year<WH8141> was ended,<WH8552> they came<WH935> to him the second<WH8145> year,<WH8141> and said<WH559> to him,<WH3582> "We will not hide from my lord<WH113> how our money<WH3701> is all spent,<WH8552> and the herds<WH4735> of livestock<WH929> are my<WH413> lord<WH113>'s. There is nothing left<WH7604> in the sight<WH6440> of my lord,<WH113> but our bodies,<WH1472> and our lands.<WH127>

Why should we die<WH4191> before your eyes,<WH5869> both we and our land?<WH127> Buy<WH7069> us and our land<WH127> for bread,<WH3899> and we and our land<WH127> will be servants<WH5650> to Pharaoh.<WH6547> Give<WH5414> us seed,<WH2233> that we may live,<WH2421> and not die,<WH4191> and that the land<WH127> won't<WH3456> be desolate."

So Joseph<WH3130> bought<WH7069> all the land<WH127> of Egypt<WH4714> for Pharaoh,<WH6547> for every man<WH376> of the Egyptians<WH4714> sold<WH4376> his field,<WH7704> because the famine<WH7458> was severe<WH2388> on them,<WH776> and the land became Pharaoh<WH6547>'s.
As for the people,<WH5971> he moved<WH5674> them to the cities<WH5892> from one end<WH7097> of the border<WH1366> of Egypt<WH4714> even to the other end of it.<WH7097>

Only he<WH7069> didn't<WH127> buy the land of the priests,<WH3548> for the priests<WH3548> had a portion<WH2706> from Pharaoh,<WH6547> and ate<WH398> their portion<WH2706> which Pharaoh<WH6547> gave<WH5414> them.<WH4376> That is why they didn't sell their land.<WH127>

Then Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to the people,<WH5971> "Behold,<WH7069> I have bought you and your land<WH127> today<WH3117> for Pharaoh.<WH6547> Behold,<WH1887> here is seed<WH2233> for you,<WH2232> and you shall sow the land.<WH127>

It will happen at the harvests,<WH8393> that you shall give<WH5414> a fifth<WH2549> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> and four<WH702> parts<WH3027> will be your own,<WH2233> for seed of the field,<WH7704> for your food,<WH400> for them of your households,<WH1004> and for food<WH398> for your little ones.<WH2945>"
They said,<WH559> "You have saved our lives!<WH2421> Let us find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord,<WH113> and we will be Pharaoh<WH6547>'s servants.<WH5650>"

Joseph<WH3130> made<WH7760> it a statute<WH2706> concerning the land<WH127> of Egypt<WH4714> to this day,<WH3117> that Pharaoh<WH6547> should have the fifth.<WH2569> Only the land<WH127> of the priests<WH3548> alone didn't<WH7535> become Pharaoh<WH6547>'s.

Israel<WH3478> lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> in the land<WH776> of Goshen;<WH1657> and they got themselves possessions<WH270> therein,<WH6509> and were fruitful, and multiplied<WH7235> exceedingly.<WH3966>

Jacob<WH3290> lived<WH2421> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> seventeen<WH6240> years.<WH8141> So the days of Jacob,<WH3290> the years<WH2416> of his life,<WH3967> were one hundred forty<WH705> - seven<WH7651> years.<WH8141>

The time<WH3117> drew near<WH7126> that Israel<WH3478> must die,<WH4191> and he called<WH7121> his son<WH1121> Joseph,<WH3130> and said<WH559> to him,<WH4672> "If now I have found favor<WH2580> in your sight,<WH5869> please put<WH7760> your hand<WH3027> under my thigh,<WH3409> and deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> and truly<WH571> with me.<WH6912> Please don't bury me in Egypt,<WH4714>

but when I sleep<WH7901> with my fathers,<WH1> you shall carry<WH5375> me out of Egypt,<WH4714> and bury<WH6912> me in their burying place.<WH6900>" He said,<WH559> "I will do<WH6213> as you have said.<WH1697>"
He said,<WH559> "Swear<WH7650> to me,<WH7650>" and he swore to him.<WH3478> Israel bowed<WH7812> himself on the bed<WH4296>'s head.<WH7218>
